adjective.description: Not helping or supporting either side in a conflict, disagreement, etc.; impartial.
examples: during the Second World War, Portugal was neutral

adjective.description: Having no strongly marked or positive characteristics or features.
examples: the tone was neutral, devoid of sentiment
a fairly neutral background will make any small splash of color stand out

adjective.description: Neither acid nor alkaline; having a pH of about 7.

noun.description: An impartial or unbiased country or person.
examples: he acted as a neutral between the parties

noun.description: A neutral color or shade, especially light gray or beige.
A disengaged position of gears in which the engine is disconnected from the driven parts.
examples: she slipped the gear into neutral

noun.description: An electrically neutral point, terminal, conductor, or wire.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from Latin neutralis of neuter gender, from Latin neuter (see neuter).
